overview: After completion of this subject, students will have the knowledge and skill to perform and interpret focused clinical ultrasound of commonly encountered conditions of second and third trimester pregnancy problems and pelvic pain and be able to write a structured report. Students will perform, interpret, write a report and submit a log-book of 15 ultrasound studies of a wide range of commonly encountered vascular pathology, and interpret and report an additional 10 online ultrasound studies.
ilo: Comprehensively understand the indications, uses and limitations of focused clinical ultrasound in assessment of second and third trimester pregnancy
Perform, interpret and write a structured interpretive report of focused clinical ultrasound for second and third trimester pregnancy on patients and/or simulators.
Evaluate the requirements for training, competence, and certification in focused second and third trimester pregnancy ultrasound
generic_skills: Improved procedural skills for students who select a practical subject
Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to perform and interpret clinical ultrasound. A  student is expected to demonstrate: Sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound monitors across a bed and interpreting ultrasound images on standard commercially available ultrasound machines.

Gross and fine motor skills are required in performing clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate adequate gross and fine motor skills to perform focused ultrasound whilst avoiding injury to patients, colleagues and self.

assessment.brief: Multiple-choice questions following each tutorial  (25 MCQs)
Interpretation of 10 online case studies assessed by structured MCQ pertaining to each case (50 MCQ).
Complete a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies on either patients or simulators
assessment.hurdle: Students must submit a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies on either patients or simulators in order to pass this subject.
